duties_responsibilities.duty: Set strategic direction for information security initiatives, processes, and standards.
Establish enterprise architecture standards, processes, and procedures based on industry standards.
Research, evaluate, and drive next-generation security technologies to keep supported enterprise security architecture ahead of the curve.
Build relationships and collaborate with other Enterprise Architects and functional areas across the organization.
Coordinate the creation and annual review for unit-level disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
Create, refine, deliver, and evangelize information security standards throughout the enterprise.
Autonomously prepare reports and audit findings remediation plans in response to Internal audits, penetration tests, or vulnerability scans.
Participate in security event investigations producing Incident Response Documentation and ensure corrective actions are implemented.
Monitor changes in the legislative, regulatory, and contractual landscape to ensure that the information security program is always at least one step ahead.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Informatics, Computer Programming, Information Assurance and Compliance, or a related field of IT-related work experience in large, complex technical environments.
Demonstrable experience designing or managing an Enterprise IT security and compliance program.

Industry certifications, such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), etc.
Demonstrable experience in policy and standard creation and acceptance.
